intro: Ostryocarpus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered ostryocarpus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Ostryocarpus parviflorus typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
